Freezing execution
You can freeze the execution of a program by calling proctal_freeze.
proctal_freeze(proctal);
Call proctal_error to find out if the function failed. Freezing twice results in undefined behavior.
If freezing was successful, you can call proctal_unfreeze to unfreeze the program. You should only call this function if you had previously called proctal_freeze, otherwise behavior is undefined.
proctal_unfreeze(proctal);
Closing the handle without unfreezing first results in undefined behavior.
